data.name: AppSettingsTip
data.value: Don't forget to copy appsettings.json alongside your bundle if you need it to apply migrations.

data.name: BuildBundleFailed
data.value: Build failed. Use --verbose to see errors.

data.name: ConnectionDescription
data.value: The connection string to the database.

data.name: ContextDirDescription
data.value: The directory to put the DbContext file in. Paths are relative to the project directory.

data.name: ContextNameDescription
data.value: The name of the DbContext. Defaults to the database name.

data.name: ContextNamespaceDescription
data.value: The namespace of the DbContext class. Matches the directory by default.

data.name: DataAnnotationsDescription
data.value: Use attributes to configure the model (where possible). If omitted, only the fluent API is used.

data.name: DatabaseDropDryRun
data.value: This would drop the database '{database}' on server '{dataSource}'.

data.name: DatabaseDropDryRunDescription
data.value: Show which database would be dropped, but don't drop it.

data.name: DatabaseDropPrompt
data.value: Are you sure you want to drop the database '{database}' on server '{dataSource}'? (y/N)

data.name: DatabaseUpdateDescription
data.value: Updates the database to a specified migration.

data.name: DbContextConnectionDescription
data.value: The connection string to the database. Defaults to the one specified in AddDbContext or OnConfiguring.

data.name: DbContextInfoDescription
data.value: Gets information about a DbContext type.

data.name: DbContextOptimizeDescription
data.value: Generates a compiled version of the model used by the DbContext.

data.name: DbContextScaffoldDescription
data.value: Scaffolds a DbContext and entity types for a database.

data.name: DbContextScriptDescription
data.value: Generates a SQL script from the DbContext. Bypasses any migrations.

data.name: DesignNotFound
data.value: Your startup project '{startupProject}' doesn't reference Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design. This package is required for the Entity Framework Core Tools to work. Ensure your startup project is correct, install the package, and try again.

data.name: FileExists
data.value: The file already exists: {path}. Use --force flag to overwrite it.

data.name: IdempotentDescription
data.value: Generate a script that can be used on a database at any migration.

data.name: JsonDescription
data.value: Show JSON output. Use with --prefix-output to parse programatically.

data.name: MigrationDescription
data.value: The target migration. If '0', all migrations will be reverted. Defaults to the last migration.

data.name: MigrationFromDescription
data.value: The starting migration. Defaults to '0' (the initial database).

data.name: MigrationsAddCompleted
data.value: Done. To undo this action, use 'ef migrations remove'

data.name: MigrationsBundleDescription
data.value: Creates an executable to update the database.

data.name: MigrationsBundleOutputDescription
data.value: The path of executable file to create.

data.name: MigrationsBundleRuntimeDescription
data.value: The target runtime to bundle for.

data.name: MigrationsHasPendingModelChangesDescription
data.value: Checks if any changes have been made to the model since the last migration.

data.name: MigrationsNamespaceDescription
data.value: The namespace to use. Matches the directory by default.

data.name: MigrationsOutputDirDescription
data.value: The directory to put files in. Paths are relative to the project directory. Defaults to "Migrations".

data.name: MigrationsRemoveForceDescription
data.value: Revert the migration if it has been applied to the database.

data.name: MigrationsScriptDescription
data.value: Generates a SQL script from migrations.

data.name: MigrationToDescription
data.value: The target migration. Defaults to the last migration.

data.name: NamespaceDescription
data.value: The namespace to use. Matches the directory by default.

data.name: OutputDescription
data.value: The file to write the result to.

data.name: OutputDirDescription
data.value: The directory to put files in. Paths are relative to the project directory.

data.name: PendingUnknown
data.value: Pending status not shown. Unable to determine which migrations have been applied. This can happen when your project uses a version of Entity Framework Core lower than 5.0.0 or when an error occurs while accessing the database.

data.name: ProjectDescription
data.value: The path to the startup project file.

data.name: ProjectDirDescription
data.value: The project directory. Defaults to the current working directory.

data.name: RootNamespaceDescription
data.value: The root namespace. Defaults to the target assembly name.

data.name: SchemasDescription
data.value: The schemas of tables and views to generate entity types for. All tables and views in the schemas will be included in the model, even if they are not explicitly included with the --table parameter.

data.name: SelfContainedDescription
data.value: Also bundle the .NET runtime so it doesn't need to be installed on the machine.

data.name: StartupAssemblyDescription
data.value: The startup assembly to use. Defaults to the target assembly.

data.name: StartupProjectDescription
data.value: The path to the project file.

data.name: TablesDescription
data.value: The tables and views to generate entity types for. Tables or views in a specific schema can be included using the 'schema.table' or 'schema.view' format.

data.name: UseDatabaseNamesDescription
data.value: Use table, view, sequence, and column names directly from the database.

data.name: VersionRequired
data.value: This feature requires Entity Framework Core {version} or higher.

data.name: WorkingDirDescription
data.value: The working directory of the tool invoking this command.
